schemas.name: patient
schemas.description: The collection of descriptors associated with patient information for data submission to CancerModels.org.

fields.name: patient_id
fields.description: Unique anonymous/de-identified ID for the patient from the provider.

fields.name: sex
fields.description: Sex of the patient.

meta.format: Any of the following values: ['male', 'female', 'other', 'not collected', 'not provided']

fields.name: history
fields.description: Cancer relevant comorbidity or environmental exposure.

fields.name: ethnicity
fields.description: Patient Ethnic group. Can be derived from self-assessment or genetic analysis.

fields.name: ethnicity_assessment_method
fields.description: Patient Ethnic group assessment method.

meta.format: Any of the following: ['self-assessed', 'genetic', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: initial_diagnosis
fields.description: Diagnosis of the patient when first diagnosed at age_at_initial_diagnosis - this can be different than the diagnosis at the time of collection which is collected in the sample section.

fields.name: age_at_initial_diagnosis
fields.description: This is the age of first diagnostic. Can be prior to the age at which the tissue sample was collected for implant.

fields.name: age_category
fields.description: Age category at time of sampling.

meta.format: Any of the following values: ['adult', 'pediatric', 'fetus', 'not collected', 'not provided']

fields.name: smoking_status
fields.description: Patient's smoking history

meta.format: Any of the following values: ['current smoker', 'ex-smoker', 'non-smoker', or 'never smoked'; followed by free text]

fields.name: alcohol_status
fields.description: Alcohol intake of the patient, self-reported

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: alcohol_frequency
fields.description: The average number of days per week on which the patient consumes alcohol, self-reported.

fields.name: family_history_of_cancer
fields.description: If a first-degree relative of the patient has been diagnosed with a cancer of the same or different type.

schemas.name: patient_sample
schemas.description: The collection of descriptors associated with clinical information of the tumor sample for data submission to CancerModels.org.

fields.name: patient_id
fields.description: Unique anonymous/de-identified ID for the patient from the provider.

fields.name: sample_id
fields.description: Unique ID of the patient tumour sample used to generate cancer models.

fields.name: collection_date
fields.description: Date of collections. Important for understanding the time relationship between models generated for the same patient.

fields.name: collection_event
fields.description: Collection event corresponding to each time a patient was sampled to generate a cancer model, subsequent collection events are incremented by 1.

fields.name: months_since_collection_1
fields.description: The time difference between the 1st collection event and the current one (in months).

meta.format:
Numeric.
The collection event 1 should be 0, collection event 2 should be 6 if 6 months have elapase between collection 1 and collection 2 and collection event 3 should be 9 if 9 months have elapsed between collection 1 and collection 3.

fields.name: age_in_years_at_collection
fields.description: Patient age at collection.

fields.name: diagnosis
fields.description: Diagnosis at time of collection of the patient tumour used in the cancer model

fields.name: tumour_type
fields.description: Collected tumour type.

fields.name: primary_site
fields.description: Site of the primary tumor where primary cancer is originating from (may not correspond to the site of the current tissue sample).

fields.name: collection_site
fields.description: Site of collection of the tissue sample (can be different than the primary site if tumour type is metastatic).

fields.name: collection_method
fields.description: Method of collection of the tissue sample

meta.format: Any of the following: Biopsy, surgical resection, blood draw, free text

fields.name: stage
fields.description: Stage of the patient at the time of collection.

meta.format: Should be in the format of the stage classification.

fields.name: staging_system
fields.description: Stage classification system used to describe the stage, add the version if available.

fields.name: grade
fields.description: The implanted tumour grade value.

fields.name: grading_system
fields.description: Grade classification corresponding used to describe the stage, add the version if available.

fields.name: virology_status
fields.description: Positive virology status at the time of collection. Any relevant virology information which can influence cancer like EBV, HIV, HPV status.

fields.name: gene_mutation_status
fields.description: Outcome of mutational status tests for the following genes: BRAF, PIK3CA, PTEN, KRAS.

fields.name: sharable
fields.description: Is patient treatement information avalaible and sharable? If yes fill out following treatment columns: treatment_naive_at_collection, treated_at_collection, treated_prior_to_collection.

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: treatment_naive_at_collection
fields.description:
Was the patient treatment naive at the time of collection? This includes the patient being treated at the time of tumour sample collection and if the patient was treated prior to the tumour sample collection.
The value will be 'yes' if either treated_at_collection or treated_prior_to_collection are 'yes'.

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: treated_at_collection
fields.description: Was the patient being treated for cancer at the time of tumour sample collection. This includes any of the following: radiotherapy, chemotherapy, targeted therapy, homorno-therapy.

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: treated_prior_to_collection
fields.description: Was the patient treated for cancer prior to the time of tumour sample collection. This includes any of the following: radiotherapy, chemotherapy, targeted therapy, homorno-therapy.

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: response_to_treatment
fields.description: Patient’s response to treatment.

meta.format: RECIST criteria: CR, PR, PD, SD

fields.name: model_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for all the cancer models derived from the same tissue sample. Needs to be unique.

schemas.name: sharing
schemas.description: The collection of descriptors associated with model data sharability for data submission to CancerModels.org.

fields.name: model_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for all the cancer models derived from the same tissue sample.

fields.name: accessibility
fields.description: Define any limitation of access of the model per type of users like academia, industry, academia and industry, or national limitation if needed (e.g. no specific consent for sequencing).

meta.format: Any of the following: ['academia', 'industry', 'academia and industry']

fields.name: europdx_access_modality
fields.description: If part of EUROPDX consortium fill this in. Designates a model is accessible for transnational access through the EDIReX infrastructure, or only on a collaborative basis (i.e. upon approval of the proposed project by the owner of the model)

meta.format: Any of the following: ['transnational access', 'collaboration only', 'not provided']

fields.name: email
fields.description: Contact email for any requests from users about models. If multiple, include as comma separated list.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Contact person (should match that included in email column).

fields.name: form_url
fields.description: If the center has a contact form rather than a contact email include the link here.

fields.name: database_url
fields.description: If the institution has a public database and wants that link to be shared, include it here.

schemas.name: pdx_model
schemas.description: The collection of descriptors associated with PDX models for data submission to CancerModels.org

fields.name: model_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for all the cancer models derived from the same tissue sample.

fields.name: host_strain_name
fields.description: Host mouse strain name (e.g. NOD-SCID, NSG, etc).

fields.name: host_strain_nomenclature
fields.description: The full nomenclature form of the host mouse strain name.

meta.format: Use most precise nomenclature where possible.

fields.name: engraftment_site
fields.description: Organ or anatomical site used for the PDX tumour engraftment (e.g. mammary fat pad, Right flank).

meta.format: Use anatomical graft site, not collected, or not provided.

fields.name: engraftment_type
fields.description: PDX Engraftment Type: Orthotopic if the tumour was engrafted at a corresponding anatomical site (e.g. patient tumour of primary site breast was grafted in mouse mammary fat pad). If grafted subcuteanously use hererotopic.

meta.format: Any of the following: ['heterotopic', 'orthotopic', 'not collected', 'not provided'].

fields.name: sample_type
fields.description: Description of the type of  material grafted into the mouse. (e.g. tissue fragments, cell suspension).

fields.name: sample_state
fields.description: PDX Engraftment material state (e.g. fresh or frozen). If other please describe.

fields.name: passage_number
fields.description:
Passage number: When different host strains, or PDX Engraftment Site or PDX Engraftment Type or PDX Engraftment Material were used during the PDX line generation, please add passage - add rows per model as needed.
We assume that passage 0 corresponds to first engraftment - if not the case please indicate what passage 0 correspond to. passage number- add rows if columns D,E,F, G changes - if no change and always same D,E,F,G add 'all' as passage value to specify the conditions are the same in all passages.

fields.name: publications
fields.description: If model has been part of a published study include PubMed IDs separated by commas.

fields.name: supplier
fields.description: Please provide the supplier brief acronym or name followed by a colon and thel number or name use to reference the model.

fields.name: supplier_type
fields.description: Model supplier type - commercial, academic, other.

fields.name: catalog_number
fields.description: Catalogue number of model, if commercial.

fields.name: vendor_link
fields.description: Link to purchasable cell model, if commercial.

fields.name: external_ids
fields.description: Depmap accession, Cellusaurus accession or another id. Please place in comma separated list.

schemas.name: model_validation
schemas.description: The collection of descriptors associated with cancer model validation techniques for data submission to CancerModels.org

fields.name: model_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for all the cancer models derived from the same tissue sample.

fields.name: validation_technique
fields.description: Any technique used to validate PDX against their original patient tumour, including fingerprinting, histology, immunohistochemistry.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Short description of what was compared and what was the result: (e.g. high, good, moderate concordance between xenograft, 'model validated against histological features of same diagnosis' or 'not determined') - It needs to be clear if the model is validated or not.

meta.examples: high concordance between xenograft and  patient tumour

fields.name: passages_tested
fields.description: Provide a list of all passages where validation was performed. Passage 0 correspond to first engraftment (if this is not the case please define how passages are numbered).

meta.format: A list of numbers separated by commas.

fields.name: validation_host_strain_nomenclature
fields.description: Validation host mouse strain, following mouse strain nomenclature from MGI JAX.

meta.format: Full host strain name, not collected, or not provided

fields.name: morphological_features
fields.description: If model type is 3D: Organoid or cell lines, Morphological features of the model.

fields.name: SNP_analysis
fields.description: Was SNP analysis done on the model?

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: STR_analysis
fields.description: Was STR analysis done on the model?

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: tumour_status
fields.description: Gene expression validation of established model.

fields.name: model_purity
fields.description: Presence of tumour vs stroma or normal cells.

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Comments about the model that cannot be expressed by other fields.

meta.examples: MEC-1 and MEC-2 were both validated.

schemas.name: cell_model
schemas.description: The collection of descriptors associated with cell and organoid models for data submission to CancerModels.org

fields.name: model_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for all the cancer models derived from the same tissue sample.

fields.name: model_name
fields.description: Most common name associated with the model. Please use the CCLE name if available.

fields.name: model_name_aliases
fields.description: Additional model names, if known.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of organoid or cell model.

meta.format: One of the following: ['organoid', 'CRC', '3-D: other', '2D: other', 'cell line'].

fields.name: parent_id
fields.description: Please add the model Id of the model used to generate the model. If the model was not in this set, please refer to it by external id.

fields.name: origin_patient_sample_id
fields.description: Unique ID of the patient tumour sample used to generate the model.

fields.name: growth_properties
fields.description: Observed growth properties of the related model.

meta.format: One of the following: ['embedded 3d culture', 'adherent', 'mix of adherent and suspension', 'suspension'].

fields.name: media_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for each media formulation (Catalogue number).

fields.name: growth_media
fields.description: Base media formulation the model was grown in.

fields.name: plate_coating
fields.description: Coating on plate model was grown in.

fields.name: other_plate_coating
fields.description: Other coating on plate model was grown in (not mentioned above).

meta.format: Any of the following values: ['peg-based hydrogel', 'none']

fields.name: passage_number
fields.description: Passage number at time of sequencing/screening.

fields.name: contaminated
fields.description: Is there contamination present in the model.

meta.format: Any of the following: ['yes', 'no', 'not provided', 'not collected']

fields.name: contamination_details
fields.description: What are the details of the contamination.

fields.name: supplements
fields.description: Additional supplements the model was grown with.

fields.name: drug
fields.description: Additional drug/compounds the model was grown with.

fields.name: drug_concentration
fields.description: Concentration of Additional drug/compounds the model was grown with.

fields.name: publications
fields.description: If the model has been part of a published study include PubMed IDs separated by commas.

fields.name: supplier
fields.description: Please provide the supplier brief acronym or name followed by a colon and thel number or name use to reference the model.

fields.name: supplier_type
fields.description: Model supplier type - commercial, academic, other.

fields.name: catalog_number
fields.description: Catalogue number of model, if commercial.

fields.name: vendor_link
fields.description: Link to purchasable cell model, if commercial.

fields.name: rrid
fields.description: Cellosaurus ID

fields.name: external_ids
fields.description: Depmap accession, Cellusaurus accession or another id. Please place in comma separated list.

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Add crucial comments about the model that cannot be expressed by other fields.

meta.examples: MEC-1 and MEC-2 were both established from the same patient.
